lead_paragraph: The envoy, Staffan de Mistura, who made the offer as part of a new truce proposal, voiced despair over the relentless bombing of the city.

byline.contributor: Nick Cumming-Bruce reported from Geneva, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Ivan Nechepurenko contributed reporting from Moscow, and Somini Sengupta from the United Nations.
byline.original: By NICK CUMMING-BRUCE and RICK GLADSTONE

headline.print_headline: Envoy Makes a Personal Offer on Aleppo
headline.main: U.N. Syria Envoy Offers to Escort Rebel Fighters From Aleppo

snippet: The envoy, Staffan de Mistura, who made the offer as part of a new truce proposal, voiced despair over the relentless bombing of the city....
abstract: United Nations' top Syria diplomat Staffan de Mistura offers to personally escort Nusra Front fighters out of Aleppo if bombing ceases; pledge is viewed as bid to pressure Russia into reconsidering its military support for Syrian government forces bombardment of city, which has reportedly killed children.
